qas.question: What type of clay improves the characteristics of the pulps used in papermaking?
What is added for sizing purposes?
What besides china clay is used as a filler?
Pulps only contain fibers and never what?
What are chalk, china clay and pulp an example of?
When are additives for pulp purposes mixed?

plausible_answers.text: correct level of surface absorbency to suit ink or paint.

qas.question: What purposes does sizing the filler serve?
What type of clay damages the characteristics of the pulps used in papermaking?
What besides china clay is not used as a filler?

context: Besides the fibres, pulps may contain <b3_0><b4_0>fillers<b4_0/><b3_0/> such as <a2_0><b8_0>chalk<b8_0/><a2_0/> or <a0_0><b7_0>china clay<b7_0/><a0_0/>, which improve its characteristics for printing or writing. <a1_0>Additives<a1_0/> for sizing purposes may be mixed with it and/or applied to the paper web <b5_0>later in the manufacturing process<b5_0/>; the purpose of such sizing is to establish the <b6_0>correct level of surface absorbency to suit ink or paint.
